OpenSim.Region.ScriptEngine.Shared.YieldProlog.Variable Class Reference

A Variable is passed to a function so that it can be unified with value or another Variable. See getValue and unify for details. More...

Inheritance diagram for OpenSim.Region.ScriptEngine.Shared.YieldProlog.Variable:

List of all members.

Classes

class  CopyStore
 A CopyStore is used by makeCopy to track which Variable objects have been copied. More...

Public Member Functions

void addUniqueVariables (List< Variable > variableSet)
 If bound, call YP.addUniqueVariables on the value. Otherwise, if this unbound variable is not already in variableSet, add it.
object getValue ()
 If this Variable is unbound, then just return this Variable. Otherwise, if this has been bound to a value with unify, return the value. If the bound value is another Variable, this follows the "variable chain" to the end and returns the final value, or the final Variable if it is unbound. For more details, see http://yieldprolog.sourceforge.net/tutorial1.html.
bool ground ()
object makeCopy (Variable.CopyStore copyStore)
 If bound, return YP.makeCopy for the value, else return copyStore.getCopy(this). However, if copyStore is null, just return this.
bool termEqual (object term)
override string ToString ()
IEnumerable< bool > unify (object arg)
 If this Variable is bound, then just call YP.unify to unify this with arg. (Note that if arg is an unbound Variable, then YP.unify will bind it to this Variable's value.) Otherwise, bind this Variable to YP.getValue(arg) and yield once. After the yield, return this Variable to the unbound state. For more details, see http://yieldprolog.sourceforge.net/tutorial1.html.

Detailed Description

A Variable is passed to a function so that it can be unified with value or another Variable. See getValue and unify for details.

Member Function Documentation

void OpenSim.Region.ScriptEngine.Shared.YieldProlog.Variable.addUniqueVariables ( List< Variable >  variableSet  ) 

If bound, call YP.addUniqueVariables on the value. Otherwise, if this unbound variable is not already in variableSet, add it.

Parameters:
variableSet 

Implements OpenSim.Region.ScriptEngine.Shared.YieldProlog.IUnifiable.

object OpenSim.Region.ScriptEngine.Shared.YieldProlog.Variable.getValue (  ) 

If this Variable is unbound, then just return this Variable. Otherwise, if this has been bound to a value with unify, return the value. If the bound value is another Variable, this follows the "variable chain" to the end and returns the final value, or the final Variable if it is unbound. For more details, see http://yieldprolog.sourceforge.net/tutorial1.html.

Returns:
object OpenSim.Region.ScriptEngine.Shared.YieldProlog.Variable.makeCopy ( Variable.CopyStore  copyStore  ) 

If bound, return YP.makeCopy for the value, else return copyStore.getCopy(this). However, if copyStore is null, just return this.

Parameters:
copyStore 
Returns:
IEnumerable<bool> OpenSim.Region.ScriptEngine.Shared.YieldProlog.Variable.unify ( object  arg  ) 

If this Variable is bound, then just call YP.unify to unify this with arg. (Note that if arg is an unbound Variable, then YP.unify will bind it to this Variable's value.) Otherwise, bind this Variable to YP.getValue(arg) and yield once. After the yield, return this Variable to the unbound state. For more details, see http://yieldprolog.sourceforge.net/tutorial1.html.

Parameters:
arg 
Returns:

Implements OpenSim.Region.ScriptEngine.Shared.YieldProlog.IUnifiable.
